metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2098 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: Action Pack in Ruby on Rails before 3.2.22.2, 4.x before 4.1.14.2, and 4.2.x before 4.2.5.2 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary Ruby code by leveraging an application's unrestricted use of the render method.

notes.Note: seth-arnold> In Oneiric-Saucy, rails package is just for transition; The rails package contains actual code from vivid onward

criterions.comment: rails-4.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
ruby-actionpack-3.2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
ruby-rails-3.2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
